elementSpec.desc: indicates a point in time either relative to other elements in the same timeline tag, or absolutely.
要素timeline中にある時点を示す．

attDef.desc: supplies an absolute value for the time.
当該時点の絶対時間を示す．
attDef.valDesc: Times may be given in standard form, as specified in the Encoding Declarations section of the header.

remarks.p: Required for the element designated as the value of the origin attribute in the timeline tag.

attDef.desc: specifies the unit of time in which the interval value is expressed, if this is not inherited from the parent timeLine.
当該時点で使用される時間幅の単位を示す．指定がない場合は，要素 timelineの値を継承する．
specifies the numeric portion of a time interval
attDef.valDesc: a positive number, or the special value unknown.

remarks.p: The value unknown indicates uncertainty about the interval.

attDef.desc: identifies the reference point for determining the time of the current when element, which is obtained by adding the interval to the time of the reference point.
当該時点を決める参照地点を示す．
attDef.valDesc: Should point to another when element in the same timeline.

remarks.p: If this attribute is omitted, and the absolute attribute is not specified, then the reference point is understood to be the origin of the enclosing timeline tag.

On this element, the global xml:id attribute must be supplied to specify an identifier for this point in time. The value used may be chosen freely provided that it is unique within the document and is a syntactically valid name. There is no requirement for values containing numbers to be in sequence.
